pr_title: Adds tests for database migration tool and refactors database migration executors

timeline.bodyText: Use Collections.emptyList() here and remove the NON_EXISTING_DATABASE_TYPE_SETTER constant (BOOL_DEFAULT_DATABASE_TYPE_SETTER would do the job).
timeline.author: nictas

timeline.bodyText: Remove this field. Use a local variable instead. Fields are only useful for sharing state between methods, but you're always re-initializing the value of this one.
timeline.author: nictas

timeline.bodyText: Rename these constants to BOOL_TYPE, LONG_TYPE, etc. Right now, based on their name, it looks like they should contain instances of DatabaseTypeSetter.
timeline.author: nictas

timeline.bodyText: Merge this test with the next two. All three of them test whether the default configuration is correct, so there's no reason to have them as separate tests.
timeline.author: nictas

timeline.bodyText: This assertion actually tests the type setter itself (whether it supports both string types) and not the factory. Change it to Assertions.assertTrue(resultDatabaseTypeSetter.getSupportedTypes().contains(STRING_TYPE)); and remove the STRING_DEFAULT_DATABASE_TYPE_SETTER_2 constant.
timeline.author: nictas

timeline.bodyText: You've renamed the type, but not some of the variables/methods. Rename them for consistency.
timeline.author: nictas

timeline.bodyText: Do you need the entire metadata as key? Why not just the column's name?
timeline.author: nictas

timeline.bodyText: The index starts from 0 here, but ResultSet counts is columns from 1. See: https://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/sql/ResultSet.html#getObject(int,%20java.util.Map)
timeline.author: nictas

timeline.bodyText: You don't need constants for these. Just use them directly. Constants are useful for reducing duplication and giving a meaningful name to something, but here they're not doing either.
timeline.author: nictas

timeline.bodyText: Since null is the default value mocks return, this statement is not needed.
timeline.author: nictas

timeline.bodyText: Test executeMigration and not executeMigrationInternal since the latter is more prone to changes in its interface.
timeline.author: nictas
radito3
radito3

timeline.message: Adds DatabaseTableRowData interface and renames DatabaseTableMetadata to DatabaseTableData
Adds DatabaseQueryClient class with changes in type setters and implements them in the project
Adds multiapps package-info file and updates DatabaseTableRowData
